snippet: Since the American job market hit bottom in December 2009, men have benefited disproportionately from the recovery, and middle-aged women have done particularly poorly.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column cites statistics showing that men have fared better than women in the economic recovery since the job market hit bottom in December 2009.
lead_paragraph: Since the American job market hit bottom in December 2009, men have benefited disproportionately from the recovery, and middle-aged women have done particularly poorly.

headline.print_headline: By Gender and by Age, an Unequal Recovery
headline.seo: Recovery Has Brought More Jobs for Men Than Women
headline.main: By Gender and by Age, an Unequal Recovery
